intro: Gynura dielsii, commonly known as the silver-leaf gynura, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its silvery-gray underside on its leaves, which gives it its common name. The plant has a rosette growth habit and produces small yellow flowers arranged in composite flower heads. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Gynura dielsii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appearance and ability to thrive in partial shade.
